name: Versatile Tank - Fighter 8 / Rogue 14 / Dwarven Defender 18
author: Kane

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, mighty ECBers!

Now that I have internet and before RL comes crushing down on me again, I'd like to post this pretty cool build I devised a while back. The concept here is to make a defensive dwarven fighter that can hold his own in many situations. He can dual-wield if needed, or go sword / board for more AC, has EDR II, Defensive Stance, Sneak Attack immunity and Epic Dodge to round it up. He should equip Greater DR belts against each damage type depending on the enemy, and a Ring of Power just in case there's Darkfire involved. Not that he's easy to hit at all, which goes nicely with Regeneration. Scrolls of Negative Energy Protection and Shadow Shield are in order as well to protect against negative damage. The only tiny downside is that I was only able to get Epic Dodge at level 36 due to stat constraints. I could rework some stuff to add more CON at the cost of Strength, but I chose not to.

You'd expect low AB for such a defensive build, but it reaches a surprising 41 AB unbuffed. Give him some DEX gear / Potions, and it goes up to 47, a +5 weapon for 52 and bless and Aid potions for 54 AB. If that's not enough, True Strike scrolls to KD people will raise your AB to 67 for 9 seconds. Coming in hidden will also help by negating Dodge AC of non True Seeing enemies. He has EWS in his Shortswords to help with damage and 7d6 Sneak Attack. And, best of all, since he's immune to SAs himself, he can ABUSE Darkness spells (from his enemies) and scrolls.

You can set him up as a Tank with Defensive Stance and Damage Resistance items or as a more offensive combatant with Hide / Move Silently, Set Traps, UMD Darkness scrolls and IKD. Solo or in a party, this is a very hard to kill dwarf fighting machine! Enjoy!

Max - for your second build (knowing that you are a "sucker for 40th level power", in your own words), if DR isn't that helpful, if you drop to Fighter16 Rogue 13 DD10 (with the last level either DD for extra HP or rogue for a few more still points) and use this stat mix

STR: 10
DEX: 18 (34)
CON: 16
WIS: 8
INT: 14
CHA:6

then go F10/DD10 pre-epic, you'd end up wiht AB of 46 with tradeoff of 530 vs 580 HP, DR 6 instead of 12 (although the premise was DR wasn't as useful), 250 skillpts instead of 274, and if you want EWS (where I play there are high damage bonuses available so an extra +4 isnt missed), can trade armor skin or a great dex. Just a thought if "DR doesn't help much" then take more fighter to get better AB/AC.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey Dante,

That build would be a different concept. The premise isn't that DR isn't all that useful (after all, as I said, I prefer the first one). The premise is that DR isn't cost-effective with the high CON investment it requires. In fact, I can use the stats the way you pointed out in the second one, as there's no reason not to start with 18 DEX. That would net me +1 AB.

If I were to do what you suggested, I would be tempted to drop DD to just enough to get Sneak Attack immunity (5 levels) and invest heavily in Rogue.

Something like Rogue 19 DD 5 Fighter 16. That would net me the same BAB (4 Rogue levels pre-epic for skill dumps and trap updates, Fighter 11, DD 5). Then the extra Fighter levels in epics to take more feats, and with Rogue 19 I'd get Crippling Strike. I'm gonna work on that right away!

However, that is another build altogether. For this one, I fear the only viable tweak is to the starting stats. Very well suggested indeed, thanks!

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I had second thoughts about resurrecting yet another poor example of what a completed build format should look like from the abyss of buried submissions but decided to spend one last attempt to educate new builders about traps.  Apparently, the guide I posted has not been scrutinized closely enough to manage trap skills effectively by all readers yet.  So, here we go through the absolute last iteration of trap basics for Maxillian Kane.  I am sure that fact pleases all readers as much as it does me.

If these are truly supposed to be considered builds for primary tanks, I recommend reducing trap handling down below epic level and re-focus the ranks on spell saves since your Search rating won't spot them anyway,  Heck, this is a dwarf, right?  Walk through them and smash chests indiscriminately.  Protection from Elements buff should provide a buffer for wimpy dwarves.

Search need be only a modified 21 to locate deadly traps the moment your toon enters perception range.  With what you save from excesses in Disable Trap, UMD (you only need a net 33 skill level to cast level 9 scrolls w/o failures) and Set Trap (epics can't be crafted and I've yet to find an environment that sells them other than high magic realms flushed with such items or the BioWare training campaigns), raise Spellcraft to 18 (20) to gain +4 vs. spells (add to the racial) to help pad the pedestrian saves (true tanks should be as resistant as possible to spells as well as physical damage).  A final rating of 32/24/31 at least gets you into the ballpark of adequate saves vs spells, one that can be padded with common gear like resistance rings and scrolls of Protection from Spells (if you can find/buy/trade for them).

Scrolls of Greater Spell Mantle will help avoid spell effects but are easily shredded by evokers so are not a panacea to solve the spell defense weakness.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Am I glimpsing a note of weary resignation in your tone, Hip? Go and play for a bit - the incomplete builds will still be there later!

While I do understand the allure of a DEX-based toon here - good AC and AB - I can't help but think that a Dwarven Defender should carry some clout when it comes to damage. Enemies should feel it when a rock-eater stands rooted in front of them and gives it the old "You shall not pass!", and I'm sorry, STR 10 just doesn't cut the mustard - it'll just make the baby dwarf girlies giggle, particulary as this toon won't be able to wear much heavy armour. Unless the intention is to be more mobile in Defensive Stance than the rest of the time.

Rather than being a 'versatile' tank, this seems more like an 'academic exercise' tank, 'cos there's no way it'd live long enough to reach L40

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Weary?  Naturally.  At my age that is the normal operating level.  But never resigned.  Always open to new ideas, new perspectives.  But it appears sometime during my and Kail's absence a new posting format has been not only adopted but actually encouraged by veteran contributors.  And that is somewhat frustrating to witness in light of all the effort Kail made to keep it as consistent with the legacy ECB as possible.  IMO, it shows little concern for the full range of usage of these forums to shrug that off so unceremoniously.  I am glad that you recognize that some new players unfamiliar to building effective characters show up here to order off the menu but that is just fine.  We each have a different agenda. But I will do anything I can to ignite some independent designing interest if at all possible.  The fact is: Each of us have a shelf life and before mine expires I would like to instill a basic knowledge for as many newer players as possible to follow in my absence and, hopefully, to be able to contribute some new innovations of their own in the future.  That may seem like pie in the sky at first reflection, but with all the new PWs with customizations that have evolved and that have little to do with default NWN, only the player of these worlds has enough insider info to tweak builds that will address the unique environments.  And so we move forward...

I suspect you are having difficult understanding the true nature of a "tank" due to your bias for SP content so I will explain. 

Tanks are not supposed to be damage-dealers.  If they can contribute high damage, then all the better, but that is not their main function.  A tank is a moving wall from where the balance of the party can cast spells, snipe arrows or spring-and-peck-at mobs.  They also act as a damage "sink" for the party.  No doubt you've been introduced to the concept when playing a caster and needed either a sturdy summon or hench to act out that role for your "weakling".  THAT is exactly what a DwD does. And the fact that Dodge is a prereq reinforces the fact that the class is designed to be shifty.  Why dilute a STR focus class with a DEX requirement?  You wouldn't... unless it was intended to bloom with DEX focus.  Max recognized that fact so you'll see Epic Dodge, the ultimate tanking feat, appear.  The RL tank needs infantry support or it is doomed.  Study your history.  When a mine field clears a tank push of all its infantry, some tanks may move on, but they are doomed by flanking attacks from tank busters without infantry to shoot the launchers.  Same for DwD.  It avoids AoOs like crazy and absorbs huge amounts of opposed damage allowing their "infantry" to inflict the main damage with realtive impunity.

Now, this not to say a DEX DwD cannot solo, but this one was never designed with that as primary focus.  I often used a non-tank divine clc/DwD/rog Dexer to scout out a new server solo because it had high HP, was impossible to flank, could sneak well and did serious self-buffed damage with a mundane dwarven waraxe.  The fact that the combo was so feat-starved only meant that I would not have much in terms of special attacks but you can't have everything, else no one would play any design but THAT one. *lol*

posts.content: Oh, that's good, I get it now - many thanks, and apologies for assumptions. Oh, and while my martial history studies only go from the Punic Wars to the Crimea, I get what you mean - scout positions, then use light infantry, supported by their heavy cousins and light cavalry establish a baulkhead, allowing medium infantry, artillery and heavy cavalry to consolidate, flank and decimate, moving things forward once more. 'Twas as true of Hannibal as Napoleon. I suspect I was thinking more defensively than offensively. Nonetheless, cheers!

I suffered from the same copy/paste annoyance as you, but stumbled on the remedy.  All those Microsoft Office apps format the text and forumer hates the formatting.  So just copy all cells to Notepad, then select all/copy the Notepad version to the forum editor (I use CTRL-V). The second copy purges the buffer of the formatted version and replaces it with the Notepad Unicode one.  All done in two steps except your comments.  Actually, I add another step from Excel to MSWord for a global clean-up before pasting to ECB so I can fit the class schedule and skill schedule in the same table to print-out on a single side of paper.  Yes, I know you paste the thing into your journal so you'll skip that step I guess.  Regardless of which way you go, the formatting must be stripped before pasting to forumer.  I suspect Empyre knew this for a long time becuuse I never noticed any of the screwball spacing in any of his builds.
